intro: Tetramerium glutinosum, commonly known as sticky tetramerium, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its sticky, glandular leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
